summary: This document is an email chain from September 2020 within the FBI regarding the upcoming publication of a Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) report concerning the 2006-2008 Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The emails discuss the need for a sensitivity review to ensure the report's release does not impact the FBI's legal stance or ongoing investigations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the OPR report being reviewed, which concerns the handling of his case during 2006-2008.

events.title: Epstein Investigation Period
events.description: The time period covered by the OPR report regarding the Southern District of Florida's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter.

events.title: OPR Report Review Deadline Discussion
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss the need to complete a sensitivity review of the OPR report by an upcoming Friday to assess impact on the FBI's legal position and ongoing investigations.

locations: 950 Pennsylvania Avenue, NXC â€” Room 3266, Washington, D.C. 20530
keyFacts: The Department of Justice Office of Professional Responsibility (OPR) produced a draft report on the Southern District of Florida's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein matter from 2006-2008.

The FBI's Litigation Support Unit and a Special Agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit were conducting a sensitivity review of the OPR report prior to its publication.
The review's purpose was to ensure the report's release would not impact the FBI's '7A stance' (likely a legal or investigative position) or any ongoing investigations.
The email chain indicates the report was too large to email and was sent in two parts, and it was to be treated with confidentiality.
The correspondence shows internal FBI coordination regarding the potential public release of a critical DOJ report on the Epstein case.
